cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 75 miles south of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward the southeast Louisiana coast, then turning north and northeast across Louisiana and western Mississippi
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast near Port Fourchon

weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Pearl River, MS to the Alabama/Florida border (Tropical-Storm-Warning coast segment)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward across Mississippi and coastal Alabama
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (>80%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds with gusts possibly reaching hurricane force in squalls Sunday evening through early Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 4–7 ft inundation possible along the Mississippi coast, including Pascagoula and surrounding bays
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–18 inches with locally higher totals; life-threatening flash and river flooding expected
weather_observation.other_hazards: Scattered tornadoes in outer rainbands, dangerous surf and rip currents hampering vessel movements
